Try this:
Right-click on the project in eclipse.
Choose properties
Choose j=
ava buildpath
Choose libraries
     * add any jars that you need there. If =
you are using maven I find it
helpful to add the jars using "add variable",=
 Configure a variable called
MAVEN_REPO (or whatever you fancy). As soon as=
 you have that variable you
can click on it and press the extend... button =
and browse to the library you
want relative to the variable. This is very n=
ice to have in a multi
developer situation since the mvn-repo may be in dif=
ferent locations for
different developers and all each developer needs to d=
o is to configure
their own MAVEN_REPO variable.

Finally, go to the tab "o=
rder and export". In this tab you can change the
order of your Classpath. M=
ake sure that the JPA-api is suficiently high in
that list. That should do =
it.

The above should resolve the issue (you might need to remove your laun=
ches
for your new settings to be propagated there)

But it should also do t=
he trick just to change which JRE you launch with
(either configure it glob=
ally or locally in the project-properties). Did you
try that?

I hope this =
helps, hunting classpath-issues can really be frustrating. My
sympathies.
/=
J
